title: Lonesome George
summary: Lonesome George (Spanish: Solitario George or Jorge, c. 1910[1][2][3][4] – June 24, 2012) was a male Pinta Island tortoise (Chelonoidis abingdonii) and the last known individual of the species.[5][6][7][8] In his last years, he was known as the rarest creature in the world. George serves as an important symbol for conservation efforts in the Galápagos Islands and throughout the world.[9]
